{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Production Officer",
  "description": "Winnys Meals on the Move Nigeria Limited is a Nigerian fast-food restaurant, with outlets in Badagry, Festac, Abuja Asokoro, international airport. Our services include Eat-In, Outdoor catering, Bulk soup orders, and Food delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Production Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Asokoro, Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary

The Production Staff is responsible for preparing, cooking, and presenting food items in strict compliance with Winnys Meals On The Move Nig Ltd&rsquo;s standards for quality, hygiene, and speed.

Duties/Responsibilities:


	Prepare raw ingredients for cooking (e.g., washing, cutting, marinating, seasoning, portioning) according to recipe specifications and daily production plans.
	Cook food items including but not limited to rice dishes, soups, meats, pastries, and side items using appropriate equipment (stove, oven, fryer, grill, etc.).
	Adhere strictly to kitchen timelines to ensure meals are ready during peak hours and demand periods.
	Follow standardized recipes and procedures to maintain consistent taste, appearance, and quality across all branches.
	Practice excellent personal hygiene (e.g., hand washing, clean uniforms, hair nets, gloves).
	Ensure cleanliness and sanitization of workstations, utensils, kitchen surfaces, cutting boards, and equipment before and after use.
	Operate kitchen appliances and equipment safely and report any malfunctions to the maintenance team or supervisor.
	Ensure all equipment (knives, mixers, fryers, blenders, etc.) are cleaned, dried, and stored appropriately after use.


Requirements


	At least 2 years relevant experience
	Strong attention to detail and commitment to cleanliness.
	Ability to follow directions and standardized processes.
	Multitasking and time management under pressure.
	Team spirit and effective communication with co-workers.
	Basic knowledge of food safety and cooking techniques.
	Willingness to learn and adapt to new recipes and processes.


Salary
N65,000 / month

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrwinnysmeal@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Production Officer&quot; as the subject of the email.",

Production Officer Job at Winnys Meals on the Move Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Winnys Meals on the Move Nigeria Limited is a Nigerian fast-food restaurant, with outlets in Badagry, Festac, Abuja Asokoro, international airport. Our services include Eat-In, Outdoor catering, Bulk soup orders, and Food delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Production Officer
Job Location: Asokoro, Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary

The Production Staff is responsible for preparing, cooking, and presenting food items in strict compliance with Winnys Meals On The Move Nig Ltd’s standards for quality, hygiene, and speed.

Duties/Responsibilities:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Prepare raw ingredients for cooking (e.g., washing, cutting, marinating, seasoning, portioning) according to recipe specifications and daily production plans.
	Cook food items including but not limited to rice dishes, soups, meats, pastries, and side items using appropriate equipment (stove, oven, fryer, grill, etc.).
	Adhere strictly to kitchen timelines to ensure meals are ready during peak hours and demand periods.
	Follow standardized recipes and procedures to maintain consistent taste, appearance, and quality across all branches.
	Practice excellent personal hygiene (e.g., hand washing, clean uniforms, hair nets, gloves).
	Ensure cleanliness and sanitization of workstations, utensils, kitchen surfaces, cutting boards, and equipment before and after use.
	Operate kitchen appliances and equipment safely and report any malfunctions to the maintenance team or supervisor.
	Ensure all equipment (knives, mixers, fryers, blenders, etc.) are cleaned, dried, and stored appropriately after use.


Requirements


	At least 2 years relevant experience
	Strong attention to detail and commitment to cleanliness.
	Ability to follow directions and standardized processes.
	Multitasking and time management under pressure.
	Team spirit and effective communication with co-workers.
	Basic knowledge of food safety and cooking techniques.
	Willingness to learn and adapt to new recipes and processes.


Salary
N65,000 / month

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrwinnysmeal@gmail.com using "Production Officer" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Reporter / Editor (IT-Savvy)",
  "description": "May Publishing Limited is a&nbsp;vibrant and growing media house passionate about capturing stories through photography, videography, lifestyle events, and curated group tours.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Reporter / Editor (IT-Savvy)
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Digital Media / News Blog

Job Summary


	We are seeking a dynamic and ambitious young Reporter/Editor to join our fast-growing digital news platform based in Lagos.
	The ideal candidate must have a passion for news writing, strong editorial judgment, and be highly IT-savvy, with the ability to manage content across digital platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Research, write, and edit original news content for publication.
	Conduct interviews, cover live events, and generate story ideas.
	Curate and manage content across social media platforms.
	Edit submissions and ensure factual accuracy, clarity, and engagement.
	Work with the tech and design team to optimize stories for SEO and readability.
	Upload and format stories on the blog using content management systems (CMS).
	Monitor news trends and stay updated with local and global developments.


Requirements


	Minimum of a Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Mass Communication, Journalism, English, or related fields.
	1 &ndash; 3 years of experience in journalism, blogging, or online media (fresh graduates with strong portfolios may apply).
	Excellent writing, proofreading, and editorial skills.
	Strong understanding of digital journalism and multimedia storytelling.
	Proficiency in IT and content management systems (e.g., WordPress).
	Familiarity with SEO, basic graphic design tools (e.g., Canva), and social media analytics.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
	Creative, resourceful, and passionate about news and storytelling.


Preferred Skills:


	Video editing or basic photography skills.
	Experience with social media management tools (e.g., Buffer, Hootsuite).
	Knowledge of local and national news landscape in Nigeria.


Remuneration
Competitive, based on experience and performance.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to:&nbsp;maypublishingltd@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-20",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

  },

Reporter / Editor (IT-Savvy) Job at May Publishing Limited




        
    

        
        May Publishing Limited is a vibrant and growing media house passionate about capturing stories through photography, videography, lifestyle events, and curated group tours.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Reporter / Editor (IT-Savvy)
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Digital Media / News Blog

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a dynamic and ambitious young Reporter/Editor to join our fast-growing digital news platform based in Lagos.
	The ideal candidate must have a passion for news writing, strong editorial judgment, and be highly IT-savvy, with the ability to manage content across digital platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Research, write, and edit original news content for publication.
	Conduct interviews, cover live events, and generate story ideas.
	Curate and manage content across social media platforms.
	Edit submissions and ensure factual accuracy, clarity, and engagement.
	Work with the tech and design team to optimize stories for SEO and readability.
	Upload and format stories on the blog using content management systems (CMS).
	Monitor news trends and stay updated with local and global developments.


Requirements


	Minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in Mass Communication, Journalism, English, or related fields.
	1 – 3 years of experience in journalism, blogging, or online media (fresh graduates with strong portfolios may apply).
	Excellent writing, proofreading, and editorial skills.
	Strong understanding of digital journalism and multimedia storytelling.
	Proficiency in IT and content management systems (e.g., WordPress).
	Familiarity with SEO, basic graphic design tools (e.g., Canva), and social media analytics.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
	Creative, resourceful, and passionate about news and storytelling.


Preferred Skills:


	Video editing or basic photography skills.
	Experience with social media management tools (e.g., Buffer, Hootsuite).
	Knowledge of local and national news landscape in Nigeria.


Remuneration
Competitive, based on experience and performance.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: maypublishingltd@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Restaurant General Manager",
  "description": "The Foodhub by CWC (TFH) is a thriving fast casual restaurant providing a diverse menu of local and continental options to corporate and individual guests. With over 13 years in the hospitality space, our continued success stems from providing the highest quality of food and service to our guests.&nbsp;TFH caters to busy professionals, families, food enthusiasts, students, and tourists looking for delicious and fast dining experiences. Established in 2021, TFH has quickly become a go-to destination for healthy and flavourful options.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant General Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Operations &amp; Production Management:


	Oversee day-to-day operations and production of the restaurant outlets, including staffing, scheduling, inventory management, procurement, maintenance, logistics, and quality control.
	Ensure the production department is functioning according to standard operating procedures
	Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations and maintain cleanliness standards.
	Implement and enforce standard operating procedures across all departments to optimise efficiency and productivity.


Team Leadership and Development:


	Participate in recruitment processes, train and mentor staff to uphold company standards for service, food quality, and hospitality.
	Foster a positive work environment and promote teamwork and collaboration among team members.
	Conduct regular performance evaluations and provide feedback to HR and leadership team to drive continuous improvement.


Customer Service:


	Lead by example in providing exceptional customer service and resolving guest concerns or complaints promptly and effectively.
	Implement strategies to enhance the guest experience and build customer loyalty.
	Monitor online sales/orders, online reviews and feedback platforms to address any issues and capitalise on positive feedback.
	Ensure all e-commerce platforms are functioning at full capacity.


Financial Management:


	Develop and manage budgets, forecasts, and financial goals to achieve profitability targets.Operations &amp; Production Management:
	Oversee day-to-day operations and production of the restaurant outlets, including staffing, scheduling, inventory management, procurement, maintenance, logistics, and quality control.
	Ensure the production department is functioning according to standard operating procedures.


Team Leadership and Development:


	Participate in recruitment processes, train and mentor staff to uphold company standards for service, food quality, and hospitality.
	Foster a positive work environment and promote teamwork and collaboration among team members.
	Conduct regular performance evaluations and provide feedback to HR and leadership team to drive continuous improvement.
	Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations and maintain cleanliness standards.
	Implement and enforce standard operating procedures across all departments to optimise efficiency and productivity
	Monitor costs, including food, labour, and overhead expenses, and implement cost-saving initiatives as needed.
	Analyse financial reports and key performance indicators to identify trends and areas for improvement.


Marketing and Sales:


	Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and execute marketing initiatives to drive sales and increase brand awareness.
	Monitor sales performance and adjust strategies as necessary to achieve revenue targets.
	Identify opportunities for business growth and expansion within the local market.


Strategy &amp; Community Development:


	Develop strategies for growth and expansion alongside the leadership team
	Review SOPs periodically to align with the vision of the business
	Build relationships with local businesses, schools, and community organisations to increase brand visibility and engagement.
	Participate in community events and sponsorships to support the restaurant&#39;s presence and reputation.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Master`s Degree with 5 - 10 years of experience.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV&nbsp;to:&nbsp;careers@thefoodhubcwc.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Restaurant General Manager Job at  Foodhub by CWC




        
    

        
        The Foodhub by CWC (TFH) is a thriving fast casual restaurant providing a diverse menu of local and continental options to corporate and individual guests. With over 13 years in the hospitality space, our continued success stems from providing the highest quality of food and service to our guests. TFH caters to busy professionals, families, food enthusiasts, students, and tourists looking for delicious and fast dining experiences. Established in 2021, TFH has quickly become a go-to destination for healthy and flavourful options.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant General Manager

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Responsibilities
Operations & Production Management:


	Oversee day-to-day operations and production of the restaurant outlets, including staffing, scheduling, inventory management, procurement, maintenance, logistics, and quality control.
	Ensure the production department is functioning according to standard operating procedures
	Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations and maintain cleanliness standards.
	Implement and enforce standard operating procedures across all departments to optimise efficiency and productivity.


Team Leadership and Development:


	Participate in recruitment processes, train and mentor staff to uphold company standards for service, food quality, and hospitality.
	Foster a positive work environment and promote teamwork and collaboration among team members.
	Conduct regular performance evaluations and provide feedback to HR and leadership team to drive continuous improvement.


Customer Service:


	Lead by example in providing exceptional customer service and resolving guest concerns or complaints promptly and effectively.
	Implement strategies to enhance the guest experience and build customer loyalty.
	Monitor online sales/orders, online reviews and feedback platforms to address any issues and capitalise on positive feedback.
	Ensure all e-commerce platforms are functioning at full capacity.


Financial Management:


	Develop and manage budgets, forecasts, and financial goals to achieve profitability targets.Operations & Production Management:
	Oversee day-to-day operations and production of the restaurant outlets, including staffing, scheduling, inventory management, procurement, maintenance, logistics, and quality control.
	Ensure the production department is functioning according to standard operating procedures.


Team Leadership and Development:


	Participate in recruitment processes, train and mentor staff to uphold company standards for service, food quality, and hospitality.
	Foster a positive work environment and promote teamwork and collaboration among team members.
	Conduct regular performance evaluations and provide feedback to HR and leadership team to drive continuous improvement.
	Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations and maintain cleanliness standards.
	Implement and enforce standard operating procedures across all departments to optimise efficiency and productivity
	Monitor costs, including food, labour, and overhead expenses, and implement cost-saving initiatives as needed.
	Analyse financial reports and key performance indicators to identify trends and areas for improvement.


Marketing and Sales:


	Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and execute marketing initiatives to drive sales and increase brand awareness.
	Monitor sales performance and adjust strategies as necessary to achieve revenue targets.
	Identify opportunities for business growth and expansion within the local market.


Strategy & Community Development:


	Develop strategies for growth and expansion alongside the leadership team
	Review SOPs periodically to align with the vision of the business
	Build relationships with local businesses, schools, and community organisations to increase brand visibility and engagement.
	Participate in community events and sponsorships to support the restaurant's presence and reputation.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Master`s Degree with 5 - 10 years of experience.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@thefoodhubcwc.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant",
  "description": "EON Global Telecom is a customer-focused company providing cutting-edge fiber optic telecommunication services such as high-speed Fiber Internet, Streaming Services, and full feature of Internet Services. EON Global Telecom is an NCC licensed Internet Service Provider (ISP) and Internet Access Provider (IAP).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location:&nbsp;Ogwashi Uku, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Our affiliate company is looking for a detail-oriented and proactive Accountant and Assistant Office Manager to join our agricultural operations in Ogwashi Uku.
	This crucial dual-role position requires a candidate with strong financial acumen, excellent administrative skills, and a deep understanding of Nigerian tax regulations at both the Federal and State (Delta State) levels.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for the full range of accounting duties and provide essential administrative support to ensure the efficient operation of the farm office.


Key Responsibilities
Accounting and Financial Management:


	Prepare accurate and timely monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow reports for management review.
	Develop comprehensive annual operating budgets and cash flow forecasts, monitoring actual financial performance against budget and providing insightful variance analysis.
	Ensure strict compliance and timely remittance of all relevant taxes, leveraging current knowledge of the Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS) regulations (including VAT, WHT, CIT) and applicable Delta State tax laws (e.g., Personal Income Tax, Land Use Charge).
	Accurately prepare and process the monthly payroll for all farm staff, ensuring timely computation and remittance of PAYE (Delta State), Pension, and NSITF contributions.
	Maintain the general ledger, manage accounts payable and receivable, and perform bank reconciliations using Quickbooks Accounting Software.
	Maintain a detailed fixed asset register, including proper capitalization, depreciation tracking (especially for farm equipment and infrastructure), and inventory management for farm supplies.


Office Administration and Support:


	Assist the officer manager as the primary administrative support, ensuring the smooth operation of the farm office, including managing records, coordinating communication, and handling mail/deliveries.
	Assist the Office Manager with basic HR functions such as maintaining confidential personnel files, coordinating staff documentation, and managing office supplies.
	Manage relationships with key vendors, process purchase orders, and monitor contracts for services and supplies.


Required Qualifications and Experience
Education:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree (B.Sc./HND) in Accounting, Finance, or a related discipline.
	Certification: Progress towards or full certification (ICAN).


Experience:


	Minimum of 3 years of hands-on accounting experience, preferably within the agricultural, manufacturing, or similar operational sectors.
	Proven proficiency in using QuickBooks Accounting Software or a similar globally recognized accounting platform.
	Demonstrable experience in preparing comprehensive financial statements and operational budgets.
	Expertise in preparing and processing payroll and managing statutory deductions.


Core Competencies and Skills:


	Excellent, demonstrable understanding of Nigerian Federal and Delta State tax laws and regulatory compliance requirements.
	Exceptional precision in data entry, reporting, and financial reconciliation.
	Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and proven competency with accounting software, QuickBooks.
	Absolute commitment to maintaining the confidentiality and integrity of all financial and personnel data.
	Strong verbal and written communication skills for internal reporting and external liaison (tax authorities, banks).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;career@eontelecom.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-18",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

Accountant Job at EON Global Telecom Limited




        
    

        
        EON Global Telecom is a customer-focused company providing cutting-edge fiber optic telecommunication services such as high-speed Fiber Internet, Streaming Services, and full feature of Internet Services. EON Global Telecom is an NCC licensed Internet Service Provider (ISP) and Internet Access Provider (IAP).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location: Ogwashi Uku, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Our affiliate company is looking for a detail-oriented and proactive Accountant and Assistant Office Manager to join our agricultural operations in Ogwashi Uku.
	This crucial dual-role position requires a candidate with strong financial acumen, excellent administrative skills, and a deep understanding of Nigerian tax regulations at both the Federal and State (Delta State) levels.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for the full range of accounting duties and provide essential administrative support to ensure the efficient operation of the farm office.


Key Responsibilities
Accounting and Financial Management:


	Prepare accurate and timely monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow reports for management review.
	Develop comprehensive annual operating budgets and cash flow forecasts, monitoring actual financial performance against budget and providing insightful variance analysis.
	Ensure strict compliance and timely remittance of all relevant taxes, leveraging current knowledge of the Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS) regulations (including VAT, WHT, CIT) and applicable Delta State tax laws (e.g., Personal Income Tax, Land Use Charge).
	Accurately prepare and process the monthly payroll for all farm staff, ensuring timely computation and remittance of PAYE (Delta State), Pension, and NSITF contributions.
	Maintain the general ledger, manage accounts payable and receivable, and perform bank reconciliations using Quickbooks Accounting Software.
	Maintain a detailed fixed asset register, including proper capitalization, depreciation tracking (especially for farm equipment and infrastructure), and inventory management for farm supplies.


Office Administration and Support:


	Assist the officer manager as the primary administrative support, ensuring the smooth operation of the farm office, including managing records, coordinating communication, and handling mail/deliveries.
	Assist the Office Manager with basic HR functions such as maintaining confidential personnel files, coordinating staff documentation, and managing office supplies.
	Manage relationships with key vendors, process purchase orders, and monitor contracts for services and supplies.


Required Qualifications and Experience
Education:


	Bachelor’s Degree (B.Sc./HND) in Accounting, Finance, or a related discipline.
	Certification: Progress towards or full certification (ICAN).


Experience:


	Minimum of 3 years of hands-on accounting experience, preferably within the agricultural, manufacturing, or similar operational sectors.
	Proven proficiency in using QuickBooks Accounting Software or a similar globally recognized accounting platform.
	Demonstrable experience in preparing comprehensive financial statements and operational budgets.
	Expertise in preparing and processing payroll and managing statutory deductions.


Core Competencies and Skills:


	Excellent, demonstrable understanding of Nigerian Federal and Delta State tax laws and regulatory compliance requirements.
	Exceptional precision in data entry, reporting, and financial reconciliation.
	Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and proven competency with accounting software, QuickBooks.
	Absolute commitment to maintaining the confidentiality and integrity of all financial and personnel data.
	Strong verbal and written communication skills for internal reporting and external liaison (tax authorities, banks).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: career@eontelecom.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Personal Assistant",
  "description": "Changeroom was established in 2012 with a vision to produce quality human resource solutions. We plan to achieve this by partnering with our clients to provide highly specialized consulting services in the areas of human resources development and business management services. Our partnership approach affords us the opportunity of working with you to find the most efficient and appropriate solutions to meet your short, medium and long-term goals. In partnering with your organization, we make it our business to understand your business, embrace its values, aims and objectives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities

Personal Assistant Job at the Changeroom




        
    

        
        Changeroom was established in 2012 with a vision to produce quality human resource solutions. We plan to achieve this by partnering with our clients to provide highly specialized consulting services in the areas of human resources development and business management services. Our partnership approach affords us the opportunity of working with you to find the most efficient and appropriate solutions to meet your short, medium and long-term goals. In partnering with your organization, we make it our business to understand your business, embrace its values, aims and objectives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Responsibilities


	Acting as a first point of contact for callers, dealing with emails and phone calls by responding, passing on messages or highlighting them for their manager’s attention
	Managing diaries and organising meetings and appointments, often controlling access to the manager/executive
	Booking and arranging travel, transport and accommodation
	Organising events and conferences
	Reminding the manager/executive of important tasks and deadlines
	Typing, compiling and preparing reports, presentations and correspondence
	Managing databases and filing systems
	Implementing and maintaining procedures/administrative systems
	Liaising with staff, suppliers, and clients
	Collating and filing expenses.


Requirements


	A Degree in Secretarial Studies or a related field
	Must have 5 years of work experience.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ginika@changeroom.ng and copy bola@changeroom.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
